verses.roman:
pūrṇaṁ varṣa-sahasraṁ me
viṣayān sevato 'sakṛt
tathāpi cānusavanaṁ
tṛṣṇā teṣūpajāyate

synonyms: pūrṇam—completely; varṣa-sahasram—one thousand years; me—my; viṣayān—sense gratification; sevataḥ—enjoying; asakṛt—without cessation, continuously; tathā api—still; ca—indeed; anusavanam—more and more; tṛṣṇā—lusty desires; teṣu—in sense gratification; upajāyate—are increased.
translation: I have spent a full one thousand years enjoying sense gratification, yet my desire to enjoy such pleasure increases daily.

purport.content: Mahārāja Yayāti is explaining, in terms of his actual experience, how strong are sexual desires, even in old age.
